org.mt4j.components.clipping

Class Clip

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mt4j.components.clipping.Clip

  • public class Clip
extends java.lang.Object
    This can be used to restrict drawing of a component, or a components's children to only the area of the specified clipping shape/area.
    NOTE: Only supported by the OpenGL renderer!
    Since:
    0.81
    Author:
    Christopher Ruff
    See Also:
    MTComponent.setClip(org.mt4j.components.clipping.Clip)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Clip

        public Clip(processing.core.PApplet pApplet,
            float x,
            float y,
            float width,
            float height)
        Instantiates a new clip. The specified clipping values are assumed to be in the coordinate system as the clipped component.
        NOTE: CLIPPING IS ONLY AVAILABLE USING THE OPENGL RENDERER!
        Parameters:
        pApplet - the applet
        x - the x
        y - the y
        width - the width
        height - the height

      • Clip

        public Clip(AbstractVisibleComponent clipShape)
        Instantiates a new clip. The specified clipping shape is assumed to be in the same coordinate system as the clipped component.
        NOTE: CLIPPING IS ONLY AVAILABLE USING THE OPENGL RENDERER!
        Parameters:
        clipShape - the clip shape

      • Clip

        public Clip(javax.media.opengl.GL gl,
            AbstractVisibleComponent clipShape)
        Instantiates a new clip. The specified clipping shape is assumed to be in the same coordinate system as the clipped component.
        NOTE: CLIPPING IS ONLY AVAILABLE USING THE OPENGL RENDERER!
        Parameters:
        gl - the gl
        clipShape - the clip shape
